titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album Iraq, Egypt, Yemen compiled by L. Wells from the Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref158
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-25 22:06:12 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Iraq, Egypt, Yemen - compiled by L. Wells - Hisham Khatib Collection
did.abstract: Created by officer Les Wells while he served with the Medical Service at the RAF General Hospital in Hinaidi as part of the "British Forces in Iraq" RAF Command and whilst he was stationed in Egypt between 1934 and 1936 - part of the Hisham Khatib Collection.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: A photograph album containing 36 gelatin silver prints of sites and people in Iraq and Egypt between 1934 and 1936.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu

did.unittitle: Left: A concert poster for The Exiles. Right: A group of performers on stage wearing white tuxedos, including Les Wells at the piano (linked to AD_MC_046_ref49 in the album 'Iraq and Kurdistan - compiled by an RAF serviceman' and AD_MC_044_ref44 in 'Iraq and Kurdistan - compiled by L. Wells of RAF Hinaidi').
